newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan's money market rates close lower.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan's money market rates close lower.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates closed lower on Thursday amid surplus funds with bankers reporting no discounting, dealers said.

The market opened on a tight note with overnight rates at 17 percent. Some deals were finalised at 15.50 percent but, at the end of the day, the market closed at 10 percent, a dealer at Standard Chartered Bank said.
The market was surplus and no discounting was reported, he said.
The rates are likely to stay at lower levels on Friday, the dealer said. -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
